div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: East Haven Parents and Guardians,

In an effort to be proactive and exercise an abundance of caution the East Haven Public Schools will be closed from March 13th through Friday, March 27th to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus, COVID-19. Additional communication will follow next week with further details regarding making up these days. Buildings will be cleaned and sanitized during this time. Please continue to reference the CDC website for information on protecting yourself and your children.
Thank you for your patience and understanding during this unprecedented time.
Erica Forti,
Superintendent

iframe.aria-label: YouTube Video, A Message from the Superintendent

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: East Haven Public Schools has been working closely with the East Shore District Health Department (ESDHD) regarding 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) planning. The ESDHD is in regular communication with our local town officials and Connecticut Department of Public Health, as well as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to ensure the health and safety of our community.
Fortunately, at this time, our community remains at low-risk of community transmission of COVID-19. However, the threat of widespread pandemic COVID-19 remains.

The best time to learn about a potential pandemic virus is before it occurs. Use the sources below to stay informed. As we continue to work with local health officials to plan and prepare, East Haven Public Schools and the ESDHD encourage you to follow the guidelines below:

ul.li: Keep children who are sick at home. Don’t send them to school. Consult your doctor.
Teach your children to wash hands often with soap and water for 20 seconds. Be sure to set a good example by doing this yourself.
Teach your children to cover coughs and sneezes with tissues or by coughing into the inside of the elbow.

Monitor travel alerts issued by the CDC specific to COVID-19 if you are planning trips, particularly for the upcoming breaks. These alerts can be found at https://www.cdc.gov/coroiiavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/index.html.

div.p: In the event of a pandemic COVID-19 affecting the Town of East Haven, you will be notified. Notices would be sent by telephone, mail, the internet and local media (newspapers, television and radio). Important information will be posted on the East Haven Public Schools web site (https://www.east-haven.kl2.ct.us). In addition, in the case of an emergency, the school system will use the East Haven Public Schools notification system to contact you as needed.
East Haven Public Schools, East Haven Town Officials and the ESDHD will take every step to ensure the health and safety of our students and staff to maintain the continuous education of our students.
For more information regarding COVID-19, visit:

ul.li: East Shore District Health Department: litlns://www.esdhd.org>
Connecticut Department of Public Health: https://portal.ct.gov/DPH/Public-Health-Preparedness/Main-Page/2019- Novel-Coronavirus
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Las Escuelas publicas de East Haven an estado trabajando de cerca con East Shore District Health Department (ESDHD) en referencia del nuevo coronavirus de 2019. El ESDHD esta en comunicación regular con nuestros funcionarios locales de la ciudad y el Departamento de Salud Publica de Connecticut, como con los Centros para el Control y la Prevencion de Enfermedades (CDC) para garantizar la salud y la seguridad de nuestra comunidad.

Afortunadamente, en este momento, nuestra comunidad permanece en un nivel de bajo riesgo de transmisión comunitaria de COVID-19. Sin embargo, las amenazas de la pandemia generalizada COVID-19 persisten.

El mejor momento para aprender sobre un posible virus pandemico es antes de que ocurra. Use las siguientes fuentes para mantenerse informado. A medida que continuamos trabajando con los oficiales de salud local para planificar y preparamos, las Escuelas Publicas de East Haven y de ESDHD lo animan a seguir las siguientes pautas:

ul.li: Mantenga a los ninos enfermos en casa. No los envies a la escuela. Consulta a su medico.
Enseñe a sus hijos a lavarse las manos con frecuencia con agua y jabon durante 20 segundos. Asegurese de dar un buen ejemplo haciendolo usted mismo.
Enseñe a sus hijos a cubrirse la tos y los estornudos con pañuelos de papel o tosiendo en el interior del codo.

Supervise las alertas de viaje emitidas por los CDC especificas de COVID-19 si esta planeando viajes, particularmente para los proximos recesos. Estas alertas se pueden encontrar en https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/index.html

div.p: En caso de una pandemia COVID-19 que afecte a la ciudad de East Haven, usted sera notificado. Los avisos se enviarian por telefono, correo, internet y redes sociales (periodicos, television y radio). Se publicara informacion importante en el sitio web de las Escuelas Publicas de East Haven (https://www.east-haven.kl2.ct.us. Ademas, en caso de una emergencia, el sistema escolar utilizara el sistema de notificacion de las Escuelas Publicas de East Haven para contactarle segun sea necesario.

Las escuelas publicas de East Haven, los funcionarios de la ciudad de East Haven y el ESDHD se encargaran de cada paso para garantizar la salud y la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y el personal para mantener la educación continua de nuestros estudiantes.
Para mas información relacionada con COVID-19 visite:

ul.li: East Shore District Health Department: https://www.esdhd.org/
Centers for Disease, Control and Prevention: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019- ncov/index.html
